A.title: JAGUAR
A.description: Jaguars are both diurnal and nocturnal.

A.title: DOG
A.description: A dog's nose print is unique, much like a person's fingerprint.

A.title: PARROT
A.description: Parrots taste with the roofs of their mouths.

B.title: OWL
B.description: A group of owls is called a parliament.

B.title: CAT
B.description: Cats are believed to be the only mammals who don't taste sweetness.

C.title: FROG
C.description: The pictured frog, a Red-Banded Rubber Frog, releases a milky toxic substance through its skin, and is toxic to both humans and other frogs.

C.title: DOLPHIN
C.description: There are currently 42 species of dolphins

C.title: RABBIT
C.description: Like deer, a female rabbit is called a 'doe' and a male rabbit is called a 'buck'

D.title: BUTTERFLY
D.description: The Large Blue butterfly is a species of carnivorous butterfly, and went extinct in Britain in 1979.  It has since been reintroduced with new conservation methods.

D.title: TAPIR
D.description: Tapirs have changed very little over the past 20 million years.

D.title: ZEBRA
D.description: The zebra's stripes are known to protect it from blood-sucking insects
